subject: RE: [junit] Book Recommendations and Where to put tests?
msgSnippet: ...  ... As one of JB s technical reviewers, I ll vouch for the wonderfulness of his book. I ve already started recommending it here at Lands End, to my
messageBody:
>-----Original Message-----
>From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
>Sent: Thursday, July 15, 2004 12:05 PM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [junit] Book Recommendations and Where to put tests?

<snip>

>The e-book version of _JUnit Recipes_ is available now for USD 25 at
>www.manning.com/rainsberger
>
> > This would include approaches to writing test
>> cases and using things like mock objects. I notice a new book is
>> coming out soon called JUnit Recipes? Any advance word on that?
>
>Yes, it is an /excellent/ book. :) (Really, it's very good.
>I'm not just
>saying that because I wrote it.)

As one of JB's technical reviewers, I'll vouch for the wonderfulness of his book. I've already started recommending it here at Lands' End, to my team. (Of course, I think that the fact that I reviewed it, helped somewhat. ;-) So, rush out and order it immediately!

Simon
